resources.string: Before using this program, you need to know four things: 1) You must tell it how you\'re billed (and update it if your bill changes). 2) It needs several days of call history to work, which means you can\'t clear your call log, or it can\'t make predictions. 3) It assumes this phone is the only device that uses your time. 4) The author isn\'t responsible for your bill.

This program uses your phone\'s stored call logs to advise you how often you may safely use your phone. It can raise warnings when you are over your time limit, and it can warn you if you are likely to exhaust your call time allocation prematurely.

Important: Avoid clearing call history in your phone! Without accurate call trends, predictions and warnings are impossible or incorrect. Additionally, this program assumes all calls on your bill use this phone and are represented in the call log; if you move your SIM to other phones, then all bets are off.

The accuracy of this program depends on unreliable factors, so you should not solely rely on it to avoid costs. The author disclaims all responsibility for its use. You are solely responsible for your bill.
If you find bugs, please submit them at http://bit.ly/timecop .

How to use Time Cop: This program doesn\'t get in your way. It sits in the background, and posts a warning to your notification area if there is something to say. As additional eye-candy that is nice if you\'re feeling nosy or geeky or bored, you may always view the prediction graph.

It represents your billing period, and time marches across it from left to right; left edge = bill begins, and right edge = bill due. The current day is represented with a vertical line labled now. Calls cause the usage line to grow upward, and if the line grows higher than the red X minutes in plan line, then you\'re spending extra money. The dashed line from now to bill is Time Cop\'s prediction about what you will use, based on the last 60 days (at most) of history. The amount of allowed time and the billing date have to be configured, before Time Cop works. Set those now, and Time Cop will vigilantly keep you safe.
